User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.2; en-US; rv:1.8.1.24) Gecko/20100228 SeaMonkey/1.1.19
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.2; en-US; rv:1.8.1.24) Gecko/20100228 SeaMonkey/1.1.19

I'm a SeaMonkey user (I will admit, I only keep V2+ as a beta option as of yet because of the way it want's to re-index mail folders all the time, in contrast to the older pre-v2 versions)  

Here at work we are drowning in attachment redundancy since all my bosses insist on having their accounts on our File Server to be auto-backed up everynight for job security, and our server is constantly in need of Archiving to DVD's.  I know a large part of this is due to the overwhelming redundancies (and bad Habits of my boss's) of the same attachment being sent and resent and such.  I, for one, have become used to stripping down my mail when necessary but I cannot control the habits of others.

Can we just get some kind of check-off switch to have a autodetach feature included?  Kind of like the way the pre-Mozilla Eudora editions had that would allow the user to pre-choose a attachment cache folder that (at least we all here) could centralize to. Copy override messaging can even be turned off for all I care.

The Redundancies are killing us - ;)

Reproducible: Always




I guess even the ability to 'multiple' select e-mails that have attachment and having a RMB menu choice to 'Detach from all Messages' option could be nice as well.

I do like having the ability that is available to port 'mail folder' that you have going with your mail suites!  Kind of what like Max said,  Outlook has on big compiled monstrosity that one has to trudge with, at least we have the ability to relocate our .msf index with it's constituant 'meat'

Thanks for That!
comments.creator: 8Eggar8@gmail.com
